mappings.label: Overview
mappings.preview_text: This workflow determines the most efficient cutting strategy when a size is below target inventory. It evaluates: Which source size to cut from, How many pieces to cut, Whether cutting is viable or ordering is better, Impact on source size inventory after cutting

mappings.label: Cut Strategy Matrix
mappings.preview_text: Oceanside COE96 Strategy and Bullseye COE90 Strategy tables showing source priorities, pieces per cut, and minimum source YIS thresholds for each target size

mappings.label: Oceanside Strategy
mappings.preview_text: Always cut from the largest available source size to maximize efficiency. Exception: Can zero out 24×24 (only 5.9% of sales) to optimize smaller sizes.

mappings.label: Bullseye Strategy
mappings.preview_text: ALWAYS check cascade opportunities FIRST (most common error!). Critical Constraint: For 3mm glass, 2 Half Sheets = 1 Full Sheet equivalent. Must verify Half Sheet ends with ≥0.40 YIS after cascade.

mappings.label: Cascade Example
mappings.preview_text: Check cascade: 2 Half = 1 Full for 3mm. Calculate cascade: Need 1 Full (yields 4× 10×10). Use 2 Half sheets → Creates 1 Full equivalent. Check Half after cascade must still be > 0.40 YIS. Without checking cascade, would have incorrectly ordered Full sheet!

mappings.label: Impact Formulas
mappings.preview_text: Step 1: Calculate Pieces Needed = Target Quantity - Current Quantity. Step 2: Calculate Source Sheets Required = CEIL(Pieces Needed ÷ Pieces per Cut). Step 3: Validate Source Inventory After Cut. Step 4: Calculate Target Inventory After Cut.

mappings.label: Impact Formulas
mappings.preview_text: Step 1: Calculate Pieces Needed = Target Quantity - Current Quantity. Step 2: Calculate Source Sheets Required = CEIL(Pieces Needed ÷ Pieces per Cut). Step 3: Validate Source Inventory After Cut. Step 4: Calculate Target Inventory After Cut.

mappings.label: Validate Source
mappings.preview_text: Source After Cut = Current Source Qty - Sheets Required. Source YIS After = Source After Cut ÷ (Source Units Sold ÷ 12). Example: 1.0 years > 0.20 minimum → Safe to cut

mappings.label: Validate Source
mappings.preview_text: Source After Cut = Current Source Qty - Sheets Required. Source YIS After = Source After Cut ÷ (Source Units Sold ÷ 12). Example: 1.0 years > 0.20 minimum → Safe to cut

mappings.label: Calculate Pieces
mappings.preview_text: Target Quantity = (Units Sold ÷ 12) × Target YIS × 12. Pieces Needed = Target Quantity - Current Quantity. Example: Target Quantity = 114, Pieces Needed = 114 - 50 = 64 pieces

mappings.label: Calculate Pieces
mappings.preview_text: Target Quantity = (Units Sold ÷ 12) × Target YIS × 12. Pieces Needed = Target Quantity - Current Quantity. Example: Target Quantity = 114, Pieces Needed = 114 - 50 = 64 pieces

mappings.label: Safety Checks
mappings.preview_text: DON'T: Cut Bullseye Full Sheet to zero, Cut Bullseye Half Sheet below 0.40 YIS, Cut source size when already at/below minimum, Cut target size that has zero sales velocity, Forget to check cascade opportunities (Bullseye 3mm)

mappings.label: Target After Cut
mappings.preview_text: Target After Cut = Current Target Qty + (Sheets Cut × Yield). Target YIS After = Target After Cut ÷ (Target Units Sold ÷ 12). Example: 0.35 years = Target reached!

mappings.label: Standard Cut Example
mappings.preview_text: Decision: Cut 4 sheets of 24×24 → 64 pieces of 6×6. Result: 6×6: 50 → 114 pieces (0.35 YIS) ✓ Target reached. 24×24: 8 → 4 sheets (1.0 YIS) ✓ Still above minimum

mappings.label: Vendor Order Example
mappings.preview_text: Decision: Don't cut, order all 93 from vendor. Result: 12×12: Order 93 from vendor. 24×24: Keep 2 sheets for future use (don't waste on minimal yield)

mappings.label: Cascade Half→Full
mappings.preview_text: Decision: Cascade 2 Half → 1 Full, then cut Full → 4× 10×10. Result: 10×10: 30 + 4 = 34 pieces. Half: 18 → 16 pieces (0.65 → 0.58 YIS) ✓ Still well above 0.40 minimum. Critical: Without checking cascade, would have incorrectly ordered Full sheet!

mappings.label: Success Metrics
mappings.preview_text: Effective Cut Sheet: ✅ Brings below-target sizes to goal YIS, ✅ Uses overstocked sizes efficiently, ✅ Doesn't violate minimum YIS thresholds, ✅ Checked cascade opportunities (Bullseye), ✅ Minimizes vendor orders

mappings.label: Cut from 24×24
mappings.preview_text: For 6×6: Cut from 24×24 (16 pieces per cut, min source YIS 0.20). For 6×12: Cut from 24×24 (8 pieces per cut). For 12×12: Cut from 24×24 (4 pieces per cut). Prefer largest source.

mappings.label: Cut from Full
mappings.preview_text: For 5×10 and 10×10: Cut from Full Sheet or Cascade Half→Full (required for 3mm). Min source YIS 0.25. Never zero out Full sheets.

mappings.label: 12×12 Available?
mappings.preview_text: For 6×6: Cut from 12×12 (4 pieces per cut, min source YIS 0.20). For 6×12: Cut from 12×12 (2 pieces per cut). Cannot cut 12×12 from smaller sizes.

mappings.label: 10×10 Available?
mappings.preview_text: For 5×5: Cut from 10×10 or Full (via cascade). Check Half cascade for 3mm. Min source YIS 0.25, never zero. 10×10 is a popular size - protect it.

mappings.label: Cut from 12×12
mappings.preview_text: Option 2 for smaller sizes. 6×6 from 12×12: 4 pieces per cut. 6×12 from 12×12: 2 pieces per cut. Min source YIS 0.20.

mappings.label: Cut from 10×10
mappings.preview_text: For 5×5 target: Cut from 10×10 as first option. Min source YIS 0.25. Protect popular 10×10 size - don't over-cut.

mappings.label: Cut from 6×12
mappings.preview_text: Option 3: Cut from 6×12 limited to 6×6 only (2 pieces per cut). Min source YIS 0.20. Last resort option.

mappings.label: Partial Cut + Order
mappings.preview_text: Result: 6×12: 20 + 40 = 60 pieces (still below target, order 29 from vendor). 24×24: 5 → 0 sheets ✓ Exception applies (can zero out 24×24 for Oceanside)

mappings.label: Flag Partial Cut
mappings.preview_text: When source is insufficient, either reduce cut quantity to stay above minimum YIS or skip cutting entirely and order from vendor instead.
